Merge pull request #156 from JelteF/patch-4

Enable bubbling of DOM change event

Enable bubbling of DOM change event

This way the event can be captured by parent elements. This can be useful when you use the change event to see if something in the form changed.

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into HEAD

Fix input bug by actualy calling moment.year 

moment.year is a method, not an attribute. It was comparing a function to a number which was obviously wrong.

Merge pull request #150 from kkirsche/patch-1

Remove moot `version` property from bower.json

Remove moot `version` property from bower.json

Per bower/bower.json-spec@a325da3

Also their maintainer says they probably won't ever use it: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/24844901/bowers-bower-json-file-version-property
Dammit.

Merge pull request #149 from Turnerj/fix/issue-134/october-glitch

Fixes #134

For Safari, the October 2017 glitch (missing month) and the October every-other-year glitch (any day after daylight savings for certain timezones displayed the wrong date).

* dev: (21 commits)
  Updated CHANGELOG Bumped Version number to 0.5.0 Rebuilt assets

  Updating built files.
  Add destroy function to Kalendae.Input which removes event listeners
  Fix error where window.getComputedStyle returns null
  On mobile the readyState is called 'interactive'
  Fixes next and previous buttons not showing correctly when current date is 1st of the month and time is before 12 noon.
  add support for week select
  When calling setSelected with the optional redraw, set the viewStartDate to the first selected date
  Updated changelong
  Fixed makefile outputting the incorrect byte count for gzipped minified standalone.
  Focus and key press events in an input field will no longer cause the field's contents to get overwritten with an incorrect date
  Prevents getSelected to return undefined Fixes #87

Merge pull request #60 from egguy/patch-1

Forgotten false positive check for IE8

Forgotten false positive check for IE8

The false positive check for IE8 is made on the main Kalendae class, but not on the Kalendae.Input class.

Without this fix, you can't use new Kalendae.Input with IE8.

Merge pull request #39 from mshafrir/ie8-compatibility

IE8 does not support instanceof.
IE8 does not support instanceof. Fall back to comparing nodeType value against Node.ELEMENT_NODE (see https://developer.mozilla.org/en/nodeType)

Fixed ChiperSoft/Kalendae#35

Merge pull request #27 from cvergne/master

Update "nativeDate"/"native" to "toDate" (in build too)

Merge pull request #26 from cvergne/master

Fix method depreciated in Moment.js still used in Kalendae
Updated to Moment.js 1.5
oops
Readme updated with new screenshots showing the new CSS3 buttons
CSS cleanup broke the class map demo.
Fixed bug with CSS selector order that cause selected days to have the wrong border.
Updated combined and minified, incremented version number to 0.2
Year/Month arrows are now drawn in pure CSS.  IE8 reverts to the old image based arrows.
Popup close button is now drawn with CSS only.  IE8 reverts to using the image.
In IE8, add a slight border around floating popup calendars, since there's no drop shadow
Added IE8 detection, appends `ie8` class to the kalendae container.
Reorganized the css a bit and added comments
Fixed some mixed tabination
Added close button to Kalendae.Input's popup calendar, can be disabled by passing `closeButton: false` on the options object. Closes issue #20
Corrected popup calendar placement when using on position:fixed containers.
More time tweaks, timezones will be the death of me.
Updated minified

Added left and right buttons for changing year, per @terrell's suggestion on issue #3.  Still needs new arrow graphics.

- Button css classes changed from `k-previous` and `k-next` to `k-btn-previous-month` and `k-btn-next-month`.
- Added css classes `k-btn-previous-year` and `k-btn-next-year` for the new buttons
- Button disable classes changed from `k-disable-previous` and `k-disable-next` to `k-disable-previous-month-btn` and `k-disable-next-month-btn`
- Added css classes `k-disable-previous-year-btn` and `k-disable-next-year-btn`
- Added two new buttons to the calendar titles
- Added new event handlers for the year buttons
- Calendar title is now white-space:nowrap to prevent the title text from altering the height of the calendar.
- Renamed internal disablePrevious and disableNext properties to disablePreviousMonth and disableNextMonth
- Added new internal properties for disablePreviousYear and disableNextYear
- Added code for disabling year buttons accordingly.
- Previous and Next buttons changed from floating to absolutely positioned to prevent the shifting of title text on calendars displaying multiple months
Fixed bug with clicked dates selecting the day before when no default selection was present.
Updated combined & minified
New testing bed in index.html
All day comparisons are now performed using the new moment().yearDay() function instead of relying on unix timestamps that have been reset.
Created new moment.ext.js source file to hold extensions to moment.js.  Moved the `today` definition into this file.
moment.js - Fixed improper argument test on #day and the shortcut functions

Added `directionScrolling` option to control if a calendar month view can be scrolled outside the allowed `direction` settings.  Addresses last part of issue #12

Adds new css classes `k-disable-previous` and `k-disable-next` which are applied to the kalendae container when the next and previous buttons should be disabled.

Default styling is for the buttons to be hidden via display:none.
Moved blackout block in the index.html file to fix the JS error in IE due to extra comma.
Merged and cleaned up commit 3bf1ac7 as per Issue #12, fixing `viewStartDate`
Fixed scope problem in parseDates, as per issue #12
Switched parseSplitDelimeter default to regexp recommended by @sambs to address issues with dates formatted with hyphens.  Closes #13.
Fix for page line-height messing up number alignment.
Updated build and minified.
If `selected` is defined on a Kalendae.Input's options, overwrite the input's initial value.
Only parse non-empty date parts.  Fixes issue #7.
Wow, I really messed up that one...

Cleaner cleaner version of @fmsf's fix for weekStart losing the first week. :P

This reverts commit 9548005b73eadba349b88a032db5400b106e68ed.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:ChiperSoft/Kalendae
Merge branch 'refs/heads/dev'

Merge pull request #10 from crstffr/patch-1

The variable "element" was not defined
Cleaner version of @fmsf's fix for weekStart losing the first week.
Rewrite of @fmsf's code for moving the active view month based on the `direction` setting.  "any" will now center the view month when there are more than 2 months being displayed.

Revert "Centered all days inside the boxes. Single digit days where not centered properly"

This reverts commit 15c89c3a275cfbad78c8819e80a8c767c1e797a8.

When setting a different "weekStart" the calendars wheren't properly displaying the full month. For example setting "weekStart" to monday, this January, which contains a day "2" on monday, the day "1" wouldn't show up

Properlly display the callender pointing to the past if the user selects "today-past" or "past" and is using a view with more than one month visible. It properly respects old logic, affecting only the callendar when there is enought space to slide the "time window" while keeping the selected dates visible.

Format date was only being applyied to dates that where comming out of the Kalendae. Meaning that when using setSelected, the default format was always required. Like this when setting a format the "setSelected" will respect it. Also if the format can is undefined it won't break the current code.
Centered all days inside the boxes. Single digit days where not centered properly
herp derp, local scope.

Add CSS3 vendor prefxies
Added demo link to the readme.
Readme tweaks
Readme file rewritten with documentation.
Compiled and Minified files updated.
Example page updated for new constructor parameters and to demonstrate the direction option.
`direction` option now works.
Changed name of first argument of Kalendae.Input to "targetElement" to match syntax on the Kalendae class.
`today` is now available to the entire Kalendae scope.  Changed Kalendae constructor to take an attachment element as an optional first argument.
Trimming cruft
Added MIT license file.
Added auto-creation using the auto-kal css class.
Moved jQuery plugin code into independent file.
Added util functions for finding elements by selector (util.$$) and performing an action on domReady.
The util object is now public available on Kalendae.util.
Fixed a troubling bug with single-day selection.
Trimmed a couple more bytes off minified version
if jQuery is present on the page, $().kalendae() will be available.
Updated minified version.

Added support for dateClassMap to add classes to specific days.
oops, got a little overzealous with that blur prevention
oops, got a little overzealous with that blur prevention
Merge branch 'refs/heads/master' into gh-pages

IE8 thinks that the year "12" is 1912, so we have to be explicit
Fix for IE8 ignoring event blocking when it comes to changing focus
updated util.addEvent to support returning false to block propagation.
Merge branch 'refs/heads/master' into gh-pages
Added Kalendae.Input for binding a calendar to an input element
Prevent event bubbling when any mouse clicks land on the container.
Merged util.getTop and getLeft into getPosition
No longer publishing change event in setSelected
Changed mouse handling from onclick to onmousedown so it calls before focus changes happen
Added getLeft() to util to compliment getTop
Removed debug tags from functions
More space saving optimizations, trying to get down to under 6k gzipped
oops, fixed minpubsub context
More advanced compile prep, but I probably wont use it since it only saves about 800 bytes
Removed unnecessary quotes
Updated minified files
Added exports.js in preparation for advanced compiling in GCC
Internalized moment within the Kalendae namespace.
Whitespace added for formatting in the combined file
Changed moment.native to nativeDate to get jsHint and Closure Compiler to both to stop complaining.
parseDates function made private, disconnected from object.  Changed how Kalendae.prototype is built to save some bytes.  Changed how Kalendae is added to the window object, may change again later.
Made some more creative blackout functions
Selected dates that are in the blackout rule can now be deselected
Renamed test.html to index.html in prep for gh-pages
Gave the base container a margin and fixed the height of the calendar separator
One of these days I'm gonna get that damn name right.
Added css class for today's day span.
Added screenshots to readme
Initial commit. Picker is working, but not very useful yet.
